info.title: Management Groups API
info.description:
The Azure Management Groups API enables consolidation of multiple 
subscriptions/resources into an organizational hierarchy and centrally 
manage access control, policies, alerting and reporting for those resources.

tags.name: ManagementGroups
tags.description:
A Management Group is a customer defined scope (grouping mechanism) that 
provides access control (authorization), policy management and reporting. 
Management Groups are organized in a strictly tree-based hierarchy.

tags.name: Operations
tags.description: Management operations supported by the Microsoft.Management resource provider.

tags.name: Entities
tags.description: A list of entities that belong to the Management Groups.

get.description: List management groups for the authenticated user.
Get the details of the management group.

put.description:
Create or update a management group.
If a management group is already created and a subsequent create request is issued with different properties, the management group properties will be updated.

delete.description:
Delete management group.
If a management group contains child resources, the request will fail.

put.description: Associates existing subscription with the management group.

delete.description: De-associates subscription from the management group.

get.description: Lists all of the available Management REST API operations.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Checks if the specified management group name is valid and unique

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: List all entities (Management Groups, Subscriptions, etc.) for the authenticated user.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: A human-readable representation of the error's details.

OperationListResult.description: Describes the result of the request to list Microsoft.Management operations.

value.description: List of operations supported by the Microsoft.Management resource provider.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

CheckNameAvailabilityResult.description: Describes the result of the request to check management group name availability.

nameAvailable.description: Required. True indicates name is valid and available. False indicates the name is invalid, unavailable, or both.

reason.description: Required if nameAvailable == false. Invalid indicates the name provided does not match the resource provider's naming requirements (incorrect length, unsupported characters, etc.) AlreadyExists indicates that the name is already in use and is therefore unavailable.

message.description: Required if nameAvailable == false. Localized. If reason == invalid, provide the user with the reason why the given name is invalid, and provide the resource naming requirements so that the user can select a valid name. If reason == AlreadyExists, explain that is already in use, and direct them to select a different name.

ManagementGroupListResult.description: Describes the result of the request to list management groups.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-01-01-preview.

ExpandParameter.name: $expand
ExpandParameter.description: The $expand=children query string parameter allows clients to request inclusion of children in the response payload.

RecurseParameter.name: $recurse
RecurseParameter.description: The $recurse=true query string parameter allows clients to request inclusion of entire hierarchy in the response payload. Note that  $expand=children must be passed up if $recurse is set to true.

FilterParameter.name: $filter
FilterParameter.description: A filter which allows the exclusion of subscriptions from results (i.e. '$filter=children.childType ne Subscription')

GroupNameParameter.name: groupName
GroupNameParameter.description: A filter which allows the call to be filtered for a specific group.

OperationResultIdParameter.name: operationResultId
OperationResultIdParameter.description: The id of the operation result.

CheckNameAvailabilityParameter.name: checkNameAvailabilityRequest
CheckNameAvailabilityParameter.description: Management group name availability check parameters.

SkipTokenParameter.name: $skiptoken
SkipTokenParameter.description:
Page continuation token is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. 
If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a token parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

CacheControlHeader.name: Cache-Control
CacheControlHeader.description: Indicates that the request shouldn't utilize any caches.

EntityViewParameter.name: view
EntityViewParameter.description: The view parameter allows clients to request that the list of entities be returned in the form of a hierarchy.
